correct_order: Mantle makes up 84 percent of Earth’s volume, and though it’s solid rock, over the course of millions of years, it behaves like a liquid.
This leads the tectonic plates on top to slowly jostle one another.
The buildup and sudden release of friction from this movement can cause earthquakes.
The movement also creates gaps in tectonic plates, which reduce the mantle beneath.

sources: The buildup and sudden release of friction from this movement can cause earthquakes.
This leads the tectonic plates on top to slowly jostle one another.
The movement also creates gaps in tectonic plates, which reduce the mantle beneath.
Mantle makes up 84 percent of Earth’s volume, and though it’s solid rock, over the course of millions of years, it behaves like a liquid.
